alert.note: Alert for Big Island North; Kohala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 23 at 3:02AM HST until February 23 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY FOR KOHALA AND NORTH PORTION OF THE BIG ISLAND... .A strong high pressure system far north of Hawaii will deliver strong trade winds and gusts today, particularly in exposed areas. Stable conditions will allow for intense downsloping gusts in the south Kohala area. ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Northeast winds 25 to 35 mph with localized gusts over 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Kohala and north Big Island. Winds will be strongest over mountain ridges and downslope of the mountains. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to 6 PM HST this evening. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can tear off shingles, knock down tree branches, blow away tents and awnings and make it difficult to steer, especially for drivers of high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Watch out for falling tree branches when walking or driving. Make sure tents and awnings are secure or take them down. Be prepared for power outages.
